class.name: ProtocolInspection
class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='exists(../../From/Protocol/Tcp) or exists(../../From/Protocol/Udp) or (not(exists(../../From/Protocol)))'><name path='.'/>: Rule must allow TCP or UDP protocols</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @httpWspRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/HttpWspRuleSet/@httpWspRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,httpWspRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @smtpRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/SmtpRuleSet/@smtpRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,smtpRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @pop3RuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/Pop3RuleSet/@pop3RuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,pop3RuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @imapRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/ImapRuleSet/@imapRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,imapRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @ftpRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/FtpRuleSet/@ftpRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,ftpRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @tftpRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/TftpRuleSet/@tftpRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,tftpRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @rtspRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/RtspRuleSet/@rtspRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,rtspRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @sipRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/SipRuleSet/@sipRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,sipRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @dnsRuleSet satisfies ($ruleSet = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/ServiceIdentification/DnsRuleSet/@dnsRuleSetId)'><name path='.'/>,dnsRuleSet: Rule set must be configured</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @httpWspRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,httpWspRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @smtpRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,smtpRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @pop3RuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,pop3RuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @imapRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,imapRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @ftpRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,ftpRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @tftpRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,tftpRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @rtspRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,rtspRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @sipRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@dnsRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,sipRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSet in @dnsRuleSet satisfies (not(exists(@httpWspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@smtpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@pop3RuleSet)) and not(exists(@imapRuleSet)) and not(exists(@ftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@tftpRuleSet)) and not(exists(@rtspRuleSet)) and not(exists(@sipRuleSet)))'><name path='.'/>,dnsRuleSet: The following attributes can not be combined: http-wsp-rule-set, smtp-rule-set, pop3-rule-set, imap-rule-set, ftp-rule-set, tftp-rule-set, rtsp-rule-set, sip-rule-set, dns-rule-set</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @redirectUnauthorized satisfies (exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/License/@automaticRedirection))'><name path='.'/>,redirectUnauthorized: Redirect must be licensed</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

(not(exists(../@chargingFormat)) or (not (../@chargingFormat eq 8)))'><name path='.'/>,noPdpAddressIpv4: No support for chargingFormat 8</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @noPdpPdnAddressIpv4 satisfies (exists(../@chargingFormat) and (../@chargingFormat eq 8))'><name path='.'/>,noPdpPdnAddressIpv4: Only charging-format 8 is supported</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @noPdpAddressIpv6 satisfies (not(exists(../@chargingFormat)) or (not (../@chargingFormat eq 8)))'><name path='.'/>,noPdpAddressIpv6: No support for chargingFormat 8</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @noPdpPdnAddressIpv6 satisfies (exists(../@chargingFormat) and (../@chargingFormat eq 8))'><name path='.'/>,noPdpPdnAddressIpv6: Only charging-format 8 is supported</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @noTrafficVolumes satisfies (not(exists(./TrafficVolumes)))'><name path='.'/>,noTrafficVolumes: The following attributes can not be combined: no-traffic-volumes, traffic-volumes</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @serviceDataInMgmtExtension satisfies (exists(../@chargingFormat) and (../@chargingFormat eq 99))'><name path='.'/>,serviceDataInMgmtExtension: Only charging-format 99 is supported</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @serviceDataInMgmtExtension satisfies (exists(@noNodeIdentifier))'><name path='.'/>,serviceDataInMgmtExtension: CDR attribute no-node-identifier must be configured for this feature</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @serviceDataInMgmtExtension satisfies (exists(@noSgsnPlmnId))'><name path='.'/>,serviceDataInMgmtExtension: CDR attribute no-sgsn-plmn-id must be configured for this feature</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @serviceDataInMgmtExtension satisfies (not(exists(@recordExtension)))'><name path='.'/>,serviceDataInMgmtExtension: record-extension is incompatible with this feature</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @serviceDataInMgmtExtension satisfies (exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/License/@adaptionOfRecordExtensions))'><name path='.'/>,serviceDataInMgmtExtension: Feature is licensed</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.name: Apn
class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @disableUplinkDscpRemapping satisfies (not(exists(./BandwidthConstraint) or exists(./UplinkDscpRemapping)))'><name path='.'/>,disableUplinkDscpRemapping: Incompatible with bandwidth-constraint or uplink-dscp-remapping settings of this APN</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $ruleSpace in @allowRuleSpace satisfies ($ruleSpace = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/RuleSpace/@ruleSpaceId)'><name path='.'/>,allowRuleSpace: Rule space must be configured under [managed-element epg pgw]</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $context in @routingInstance satisfies ($context = /ManagedElement/Context/@contextNameId)'><name path='.'/>,routingInstance: Routing instance must be configured under 'managed-element context'</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.name: Address
class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @static satisfies (not(exists(@radius)))'><name path='.'/>,static: Cannot configure a subnet as static and radius at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @static satisfies (not(exists(../@addressAllocation)) or (not(../@addressAllocation eq 5)))'><name path='.'/>,static: Static address range is not allowed with radius-local-pool address allocation method</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @radius satisfies (not(exists(@static)))'><name path='.'/>,radius: Cannot configure a subnet as static and radius at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @radius satisfies (exists(../@addressAllocation) and ((../@addressAllocation eq 2) or (../@addressAllocation eq 5)))'><name path='.'/>,radius: IP address allocation method must be set to radius-local-pool or radius</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @radius satisfies (not(exists(@subnetName)))'><name path='.'/>,radius: Cannot configure a radius subnet with subnet-name</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @subnetName satisfies (not(exists(@radius)))'><name path='.'/>,subnetName: Subnet name cannot be configured for radius subnet</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @subnetName satisfies (not(exists(../@addressAllocation)) or (not(../@addressAllocation eq 5)))'><name path='.'/>,subnetName: Subnet name is not allowed with radius-local-pool address allocation method</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

attribute.name: addressId
attribute.description: Address range for APN network

attribute.name: static
attribute.description: Range is only for static contexts

attribute.name: radius
attribute.description: Specified address range is used for allocation through RADIUS

attribute.name: subnetName
attribute.description: Name of the subnet

class.name: PdpContext
class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @enableDedicatedBearer satisfies (exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/License/@policyChargingControl))'><name path='.'/>,enableDedicatedBearer: Policy and Charging Control must be licensed</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @sharedIpPool satisfies ($attr = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/SharedIpPool/@sharedIpPoolId)'><name path='.'/>,sharedIpPool: Shared IP pool name must be configured under [managed-element epg pgw shared-ip-pool]</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @sharedIpPool satisfies ((exists(@addressAllocation) and (@addressAllocation eq 7 or @addressAllocation eq 8)) or (exists(@ipv6AddressAllocation) and (@ipv6AddressAllocation eq 7 or @ipv6AddressAllocation eq 8)))'><name path='.'/>,sharedIpPool: shared-ip-pool range is not allowed with other address allocation method except sharedip-pool and radius-shared-ip-pool</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @allowFramedIpNetmask satisfies (not(exists(@addressAllocation)) or (not(@addressAllocation eq 5)))'><name path='.'/>,allowFramedIpNetmask: Framed IP Netmask is not allowed when APN is configured for radius-local-pool address allocation method</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @allowFramedIpNetmask satisfies (not(exists(@addressAllocation)) or (not(@addressAllocation eq 8)))'><name path='.'/>,allowFramedIpNetmask: Framed IP Netmask is not allowed when APN is configured for radius-shared-ip-pool address allocation method</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @useFramedRoute satisfies (not(exists(@addressAllocation)) or (not(@addressAllocation eq 5)))'><name path='.'/>,useFramedRoute: Framed IP Netmask is not allowed when APN is configured for radius-local-pool address allocation method</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @primaryIpVersion satisfies (exists(@pdpType) and (@pdpType eq 3))'><name path='.'/>,primaryIpVersion: primaryIpVersion is configurable only when pdp-type is ipv4v6</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @prioritizedIpVersion satisfies (exists(@pdpType) and ((@pdpType eq 3) or (@pdpType eq 4)))'><name path='.'/>,prioritizedIpVersion: prioritizedIpVersion is configurable only when pdp-type is ipv4v6 or ipv4-ipv6</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.name: Signaling
class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @ggsnDeletesPerSecond satisfies (not(exists(@ggsnDeletesNoLimit)))'><name path='.'/>,ggsnDeletesPerSecond: The following attributes can not be combined: ggsn-deletes-per-second, ggsn-deletes-no-limit</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @ggsnDeletesNoLimit satisfies (not(exists(@ggsnDeletesPerSecond)))'><name path='.'/>,ggsnDeletesNoLimit: The following attributes can not be combined: ggsn-deletes-per-second, ggsn-deletes-no-limit</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.name: GxProfile
class.description: Settings for standard and enhanced Gx
class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='every $das in @diameterApplicationSystem satisfies ($das = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/Diameter/DiameterApplicationSystem/@diameterApplicationSystemId)'><name path='.'/>,diameterApplicationSystem: Diameter application system must be configured under [managed-element epg pgw diameter diameter-application-system]</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @disableGxExtensions satisfies (not(exists(@usageReporting)))'><name path='.'/>,disableGxExtensions: Incompatible with usage-reporting</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @disableGxExtensions satisfies (not(exists(@extendedUsageReporting)))'><name path='.'/>,disableGxExtensions: Incompatible with extended-usage-reporting</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @qosControl satisfies (exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/License/@operatorQosControl))'><name path='.'/>,qosControl: Operator QoS control must be licensed</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @optimizedPushUpdate satisfies (exists(../../../@controlContext) and (../../../@controlContext eq 1))'><name path='.'/>,optimizedPushUpdate: Requires control-context 3gpp</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @optimizedPushUpdate satisfies (not(exists(@disableGxExtensions)))'><name path='.'/>,optimizedPushUpdate: Incompatible with disable-gx-extensions</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @qosPushUpdate satisfies (exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/License/@gxInitiatedQosModification))'><name path='.'/>,qosPushUpdate: Gx initiated QoS modification (qos-push-update) must be licensed</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @usageReporting satisfies (exists(../../../@controlContext) and (../../../@controlContext eq 1))'><name path='.'/>,usageReporting: Requires control-context 3gpp</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @usageReporting satisfies (not(exists(@disableGxExtensions)))'><name path='.'/>,usageReporting: Incompatible with disable-gx-extensions</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @usageReporting satisfies (not(exists(@extendedUsageReporting)))'><name path='.'/>,usageReporting: Can not configure both usage-reporting and extended-usage-reporting at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @usageReporting satisfies (not(exists(@extendedUsageMonitoring)))'><name path='.'/>,usageReporting: Can not configure both usage-reporting and extended-usage-monitoring at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageReporting satisfies (exists(../../../@controlContext) and (../../../@controlContext eq 1))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageReporting: Requires control-context 3gpp</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageReporting satisfies (not(exists(@disableGxExtensions)))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageReporting: Incompatible with disable-gx-extensions</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageReporting satisfies (not(exists(@usageReporting)))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageReporting: Can not configure both usage-reporting and extended-usage-reporting at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageReporting satisfies (not(exists(@extendedUsageMonitoring)))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageReporting: Can not configure both extended-usage-monitoring and extended-usage-reporting at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageMonitoring satisfies (exists(../../../@controlContext) and (../../../@controlContext eq 1))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageMonitoring: Requires control-context 3gpp</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageMonitoring satisfies (not(exists(@pccRelease) and (@pccRelease eq 7)))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageMonitoring: Can not configure both extended-usage-monitoring and pcc-release 7 at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageMonitoring satisfies (not(exists(@usageReporting)))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageMonitoring: Can not configure both extended-usage-monitoring and usage-reporting at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @extendedUsageMonitoring satisfies (not(exists(@extendedUsageReporting)))'><name path='.'/>,extendedUsageMonitoring: Can not configure both extended-usage-monitoring and extended-usage-reporting at the same time</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @pccRelease satisfies (not($attr eq 7) or (not(exists(@extendedUsageMonitoring))))'><name path='.'/>,pccRelease: Gx PCC Release 7 is not compatible with extended-usage-monitoring</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='every $das in @diameterApplicationSystem satisfies ($das = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/Diameter/DiameterApplicationSystem/@diameterApplicationSystemId)'><name path='.'/>,diameterApplicationSystem: Diameter application system must be configured under [managed-element epg pgw diameter diameter-application-system]</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $das in @additionalAllowedDas satisfies ($das = /ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/Diameter/DiameterApplicationSystem/@diameterApplicationSystemId)'><name path='.'/>,additionalAllowedDas: Diameter application system must be configured under [managed-element epg pgw diameter diameter-application-system]</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @serviceContextId satisfies (not($attr eq "6.32251@3gpp.org") or (not(exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/@pgwEnabled) or exists(../../../@pgwEnabled))))'><name path='.'/>,serviceContextId: PGW does not support service-context-id 6.32251@3GPP.org</assert> <assert id='set' test='every $attr in @serviceContextId satisfies (not($attr eq "v1.gy.ggsn@ericsson.com") or (not(exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/@pgwEnabled) or exists(../../../@pgwEnabled))))'><name path='.'/>,serviceContextId: PGW does not support service-context-id v1.gy.ggsn@ericsson.com</assert> </rule> </pattern> </schema>

class.name: AwarePolicyBasedRouting

class.dependenciesScript: <schema xmlns="http://purl.oclc.org/dsdl/schematron"> <pattern> <rule> <assert id='set' test='exists(/ManagedElement/Epg/Pgw/License/@awarePolicyBasedRouting)'><name path='.'/>: License for aware policy based routing must be enabled when setting aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../AccessRestrictions))'><name path='.'/>: access-restrictions are incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../@pgwEnabled))'><name path='.'/>: pgw-enabled is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../Gtp))'><name path='.'/>: gtp is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../Dhcp))'><name path='.'/>: dhcp is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../BandwidthConstraint))'><name path='.'/>: bandwidth-constraint is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../UplinkDscpRemapping))'><name path='.'/>: uplink-dscp-remapping is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../@disableUplinkDscpRemapping))'><name path='.'/>: disable-uplink-dscp-remapping is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../NameServer))'><name path='.'/>: name-server is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../ServiceBasedCharging))'><name path='.'/>: service-based-charging is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../@allowRuleSpace))'><name path='.'/>: allow-rule-space is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../Charging))'><name path='.'/>: charging is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../Roaming))'><name path='.'/>: roaming is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../Sgsn))'><name path='.'/>: sgsn is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../UserCategory))'><name path='.'/>: user-category is incompatible with aware-policy-based-routing</assert> <assert id='set' test='not(exists(../QosControl))'><name path='.'/>: qos-control is incompatible with mim.author: ERAASC
mim.name: ComTop
mim.description: ECIM Top Level Model. This is the root level for the Ericsson Common Information Model. It contains the singleton, root Managed Object Class, ManagedElement under which the complete model is contained. Directly under ManagedElement are managed-function level classes SystemFunctions, Transport, Equipment and the root MOC of any managed functions. The Equipment Root MOC is in the Equipment MOM. The root MOC for a managed function is hosted in the managed function MOM.

struct.name: ProductIdentity
struct.description: A struct that contains product designation, number, and revision information.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description: The product number in Ericsson's ABC format. See Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards for information.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description: The product revision in the form R[1-9][A-Z]. See Ericsson Corporate Basic Standards for information.

structMember.name: productDesignation
structMember.description: The product designation is the common name for the product.

enum.name: AdmState
enum.description:
The administrative state of a replaceable unit. The following administrative states are supported when this enumeration is used:
- LOCKED: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users. - UNLOCKED: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability. - SHUTTINGDOWN: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the unlocked state.

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description:
The following administrative states are supported when this enumeration is used:
- LOCKED: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users. - UNLOCKED: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enum.name: OperState
enum.description:
The following operational states are supported when this enumeration is used:
- ENABLED: The resource partially or fully operable - DISABLED: The resource is totally inoperable

enum.name: SchemaFormat
enum.description:
The following Schema format is supported when this enumeration is used:
MP_DTD: The data model format is XML based on mp.dtd

class.name: ManagedElement
class.description: The top-level class in the Common Information Model is the ManagedElement root Managed Object Class (MOC). From this class, all model entities are contained. The MOC has attributes that provide information on the Managed Element Identity, primary location and the products it contains.

attribute.name: managedElementId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN. This key attribute shall be a simple alphanumeric value. The value must be unique within the network namespace.

attribute.name: networkManagedElementId
attribute.description: Replaces the value component of the RDN in the COM Northbound Interface. This attribute shall, if used, be set to a simple alphanumeric value. The value should be unique within the network namespace.

attribute.name: siteLocation
attribute.description: A freetext attribute used for storing geographic or postal address data to assist staff in locating physical equipment.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: A freetext string for additional information to assist Managed Element identification.

attribute.name: productIdentity
attribute.description: The product identities are used to clearly identify the product numbers and revisions that form this Managed Element. This can be used for a single product or several products that constitute managed functions within this Managed Element instance.

attribute.name: localDateTime
attribute.description:
This is the local date and time for the Managed Element.
The following format is used.
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss
The meaning of each field is as follows: YYYY is a 4-digit year. MM is the month within the year (starting with 01). DD is the day within the month (starting with 01). T is used as time designator to indicate the start of the time of day component in the expression. hh is the hour within the day (24-hour clock, starting with 00). mm is the minute within the hour (starting with 00). ss is the second within the minute (starting with 00).
The hyphen [-] and the colon [:] is used as separators within the date and time of day expressions, respectively.

attribute.name: timeZone
attribute.description:
This is the timeZone that the Managed Element resides in.
The possible values for this attribute are defined in the public-domain zoneinfo (or Olson) database.
Locations are identified by a string indicating the continent or ocean and then the name of the location, which is typically the largest city within the region. See http://www.twinsun.com/tz/tz-link.htm for more information.
Example: Europe/Stockholm

attribute.name: dateTimeOffset
attribute.description: Difference between the value of the localDateTime attribute and UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).

attribute.name: dnPrefix
attribute.description: According to 3GPP TS 32.300 a Distinguished Name (DN) is used to uniquely identify a MO within a name space. From a global context, the name of the same MO is the DN. LDN (Local DN) is a proper subset of DN. In the context of a particular local context, a DN prefix is defined such that all LDNs in that particular context, if attached behind the DN prefix of that context, will yield the DNs of the MOs. A DN is defined by 3GPP TS 32.300 which splits the DN in dnPrefix, localDN e.g. DN format: dnPrefix="<DN Prefix>" localDn ="<Local DN>"

class.name: SystemFunctions
class.description: The SystemFunctions MOC is the container class for all common functions provided by the Managed Element. Examples of these functions include Fault and Performance Management, System and Heartbeat Management. The common functions are categorised as either Common Base or Common Optional. Common Base functions are always present regardless of node type while Common Optional functions may be present depending on the necessary capabilities of the Managed Element.

attribute.name: systemFunctionsId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: Transport
class.description: The Transport MOC is the container for all transport related functions used within the Managed Element. Its usage is dependent on the node type i.e. the node's primary function is to handle transport functions. Managed Element Application specific transport MOM fragments are contained within an application's xyzFunctions branch. If the transport fragment MOM is used by 2+ Managed Element applications then the transport fragment MOM should reside under the Transport MOC.

attribute.name: transportId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

relationship.name: ManagedElement_to_Transport
relationship.description: Containment association of the Transport MOC

mim.name: ECIM_CommonLibrary
mim.description: ECIM Common Library is a Common model fragment where MOM entities used by 2+ ECIM fragments are stored.

struct.name: EcimPassword
struct.description: This struct stores the password which is set by an operator via NETCONF or CLI.

structMember.name: cleartext
structMember.description: Indicates if the password is entered in cleartext or not.

structMember.name: password
structMember.description: Holds the password or passphrase text.

enum.description:
The following operational states are supported when this enumeration is used:
- ENABLED: The resource partially or fully operable - DISABLED: The resource is totally inoperable

enum.name: SchemaFormat
enum.description:
The following Schema format is supported when this enumeration is used:
MP_DTD: The data model format is XML based on mp.dtd

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
DateTime represents date and time data using a string with the format "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes).
A DateTime string consists of a date part followed by a time part. When the time part represents local time, as apposed to UTC time indicated by Z as last character, an additional time offset part is added to the DateTime string.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format in detail:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|±hh:mm]
Where:
YYYY = four digit year MM = two digit month (01=January, etc.) DD = two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = time designator (shows start of time component) hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = one or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = time is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format has been further restricted:
- T and Z designators must be upper case. - T and Z may not be exchanged with other characters such as space. - '.' (dot) must be used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma). - Using 60 as value for second to indicate leap second is not allowed.

derivedDataType.name: DateTimeWithoutOffset
derivedDataType.description:
A DateTimeWithoutOffset string consists of a date part followed by a time part. The time part represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTimeWithoutOffset format in detail:
YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+]
Where:
YYYY = four digit year MM = two digit month (01=January, etc.) DD = two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = time designator (shows start of time component) hh = two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = one or more digits of decimal fraction of a second
DateTimeWithoutOffset values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTimeWithoutOffset format has been further restricted:
- T designators must be upper case. - T may not be exchanged with other characters such as space. - '.' (dot) must be used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma). - Using 60 as value for second to indicate leap second is not allowed.

derivedDataType.name: IpDNSAddress
derivedDataType.description:
The IpDNSAddress type represents an IP address, version 4 or version 6, or a DNS domain name.
If the address is specified as a V4 IP address then the address should be specified in dotted-quad decimal notation in accordance with RFC791.
IPv4 address within range [1-126,128-223].[0-255].[0-255].[0-255], 7-15 characters.
Valid characters: 0123456789.
If the address is specified as a V6 IP address then the address should be specified in colon separated hexadecimal notation as described in RFC 4291 section 2.2 items 1 and 2.
IPv6 addresses shall have a length range of 3-39 characters.
Valid characters: 0123456789abcdefABCDEF:
If the address is specified as a DNS domain name the name should be fully qualified whenever possible. Internet domain names are only loosely specified. Section 3.5 of RFC 1034 recommends a syntax (modified in section 2.1 of RFC 1123).

derivedDataType.name: DifferenceFromUTC
derivedDataType.description:
Difference between the value of the localDateTime attribute and UTC (Coordinated Universal Time).
The following format shall be used
[+/-]hh:mm
It shall be expressed as positive (i.e. with the leading plus sign [+]) if the local time is ahead of or equal to UTC of day and as negative (i.e. with the leading minus sign [-]) if it is behind UTC of day.
Example: +01:00

derivedDataType.name: EcimEmpty
derivedDataType.description: The empty built-in type represents a leaf that does not have any value, it conveys information by its presence or absence.

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.
